item.description:
The Isabella Stewart Gardner Museum does a "Third Thursday" evening event each month.

This month's event is "Budda Night"

Come celebrate and explore our new exhibition, Decoration and Devotion: Isabella Gardner’s East this evening. Explore some of the hidden Asian art treasures of the Gardner tonight as the sound of Japanese shakuhachi music fills the galleries.


The evening includes:
Courtyard Sounds:
Enjoy the contemplative sounds of the Shakuhachi, by Phil James (5:30 to 8 PM)
Gallery Travels:
Explore the galleries with this self-guided tour and discover highlights of the Gardner’s Asian art collection.
Viewfinder:
Listen in on a discussion about John S. Sargent’s famous portrait of Isabella Gardner (every half-hour), plus other impromptu gallery discussions (5:30 to 8:30PM)
Sketching in the Galleries:
Create your own masterpieces with drawing in the cloisters and galleries (6 to 9PM)
Artful Flavors:
Indulge in the culinary arts, signature cocktails including the all-new Madame Gautreau, and more at the courtside bar and Gardner Café.

For more info and to buy tickets, go to Gardner After Hours - March 2009


*** If you become a Member of the museum ***
*** your entrance fee to "Third Thursday" events is FREE ***
item.how_to_find_us: Meet at the entrance @ 5.30pm or inside the Museum thereafter
item.name: Isabella Stewart Gardner "After Hours" Evening
